column5: I know what I'm about to say is not a revalation. While fishing Lac Seul last week we of course saw water that was at least 3' above normal. The high water made some of the spots we have caught a lot of fish on in the last 30 years into non producers. Not to mention the 51 degree water temps. High cold water made us move into the backs of bays that we normally don't fish and it was a successful move. We still of course found good structure in these areas but also found 59 to 61 degree water. When we found a drop or hump or basically any change in structure we found eyes. Couple of these bays produced a couple 450 fish days for five of us and there were more 23" to 25" fish than normal. With high water being the norm for most Ontario lakes this year I urge you to do a little searching for the conditions we found success in. Hope this helps and I hope you all have a great trip and a safe one. Good Luck, Mike Kansas
We are heading up tomorrow. I hope we don't encounter flooded roads. Sounds like you had great fishing. Hump

We are going back next Friday. We didn't have any flooded roads last week but there were some spots that it was close to being on the road surface. Hope you have a great week Hump and catch a bunch. Be safe and enjoy. Good Luck, Mike Kansas
How was Sawmill? We are heading up a week from Friday. Can't wait.
Buller creek on hwy#105 has water over thecroad.its up to my bumper on my truck.just be carefull of it if travelling at night.they do have signs up.
We don't fish Sawmill. We are in the north central part of the lake, probably 30 miles from Sawmill. Mike Kansas
`Thanks for the heads up. Safe travels.
https://www.walleyecentral.com/forums...d.php?t=358873Hers a link on the 105, looks like a detour is in order. Safe travels!

Just returned from our place on Big Sand lake on the Winnipeg River, Only once in my 35 years going up there have I seen the water as high as it was and it was supposed to come up another foot, definitely throws a wrench into your normal patterns.
How was the fishing for the week?
